definitions.definition: to harm yourself or somebody else physically, especially in an accident
definitions.labels: (especially British English)(informal)(formal)(especially North American English)(British English)(especially British English)(North American English)(formal)(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: He injured his knee playing hockey.
Three people were killed and five injured in the crash.
She was **seriously injured** in a riding accident.
During the Second World War he was **badly injured** by a bomb.
She was hit by an unmarked police car and **severely injured**.
The man was **critically injured** after falling from a ladder.
insurance to cover you in case one of your employees accidentally injures someone

definitions.definition: to damage somebody’s reputation, interests, feelings, etc.

examples.text: This could seriously injure the company's reputation.
espionage activity that was likely to injure the national interest

wordOrigin: late Middle English: back-formation from injury.
